org.modelio.api.modelio.editor

Interface IEditionService


  • public interface IEditionService
    This interface defines services to open, close and select Modelio editors.

    A text editor is bound to a model element and a file, and must have one of those types:

  • "com.modeliosoft.modelio.edition.TXTEditorID" - Standard text editor
  • "com.modeliosoft.modelio.edition.MDDEditorID" - Model Driven editor, edition is only available between markers.
  • "com.modeliosoft.modelio.edition.RTEditorID" - Round Trip editor, only annotations bounds to Modelio can't be edited.

    • Each editor can be set to read-only mode.

See Also:
IMDAEditorListener

      • createDocumentContent

        boolean createDocumentContent(Document doc)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Create a document content for the given document.

        A default content is found by 2 ways:

        1. Look for a document named "default" under the ExternDocumentType with the same MIME type.
        2. Look in .projectdata/admin/documents for a file named:
          1. role_name.mime_type.dat like file
          2. role_name.dat like file.
          All invalid characters for a file name in the document type and MIME type are replaced by '_' when looked for the file.
        3. If everything failed then an empty content valid for the MIME type is created.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document to initialize
        Returns:
        true if the file was created, false if no default content could be found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error trying to create the file.
        Since:
        2.1

      • editRichNote

        java.nio.file.Path editRichNote(Document doc,
                                IExternDocumentChangeListener listener)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Get a copy of the file for a given external document.
        Parameters:
        doc - an external document.
        listener - A listener fired if the original note is modified externally, by SVN for example. null means no edition.
        Returns:
        its file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of failure.
        Since:
        3.1

      • openEditor

        @Deprecated
IMDATextEditor openEditor(ModelElement modelElement,
                                      java.io.File file,
                                      EditorType editorTypeID,
                                      boolean readonly)
        Deprecated. use openEditor(ModelElement, File, EditorType, boolean, String, String, String) instead.
        Open a new text editor, making the correspondence between a model element and a file. Use default UTF-8 charset.
        Parameters:
        modelElement - the model element to edit.
        file - the file to display in the editor.
        editorTypeID - the type of the editor to open.
        readonly - true if the editor is in read only mode.
        Returns:
        the opened editor.

      • openEditor

        @Deprecated
IMDATextEditor openEditor(ModelElement modelElement,
                                      java.io.File file,
                                      EditorType editorTypeID,
                                      boolean readonly,
                                      java.lang.String charsetName)
        Deprecated. use openEditor(ModelElement, File, EditorType, boolean, String, String, String) instead.
        Open a new text editor, making the correspondence between a model element and a file.
        Parameters:
        modelElement - the model element to edit.
        file - the file to display in the editor.
        editorTypeID - the type of the editor to open.
        readonly - true if the editor is in read only mode.
        charsetName - The name of a supported charset. If null it will be the UTF-8 charset.
        Returns:
        the opened editor.
        Since:
        3.3.0

      • openEditor

        void openEditor(Artifact artifact)
        Open an editor from an artifact.

        The file declared by the artifact must be part of the supported mime type list.

        Parameters:
        artifact - the artifact to edit.
        Since:
        2.1

      • openEditor

        void openEditor(Document document)
        Open an editor from an extern document.

        The type of the document's file must be part of the supported mime type list.

        Parameters:
        document - the extern document to edit.
        Since:
        2.1

      • openEditor

        IMDATextEditor openEditor(ModelElement modelElement,
                          java.io.File file,
                          EditorType editorTypeID,
                          boolean readonly,
                          java.lang.String charsetName,
                          java.lang.String askedTitle,
                          java.lang.String askedTooltip)
        Open a new text editor, making the correspondence between a model element and a file.
        Parameters:
        modelElement - the model element to edit.
        file - the file to display in the editor.
        editorTypeID - the type of the editor to open.
        readonly - true if the editor is in read only mode.
        charsetName - The name of a supported charset. If null it will be the UTF-8 charset.
        askedTitle - the tab title. If null it will be the model element name.
        askedTooltip - the tab tooltip. If null it will be the file absolute path.
        Returns:
        the opened editor.
        Since:
        3.6.1

      • openEditor

        void openEditor(MatrixDefinition document)
        Open an editor from a matrix.

        The type of the document's file must be part of the supported mime type list.

        Parameters:
        document - the matrix to edit.
        Since:
        3.8.0 Valkyrie
